comment._content: Yes, indeed!  That is a large hat!

comment.author: 30085166@N00
comment._content: A 1915 book titled "Genealogical History of the Quinby (Quimby) Family In England and America", by Henry Cole Quinby, offers the following about Miss Margaret Quinby (on page 330): "MARGARET QUINBY, born 21 Sept. 1888. In 1912, the American papers were full of her pictures and rumors of her engagement to a nobleman attached to the suite of King Charles of Saxony. The dispatch dated 8 June, 1912, said that she was presented at Court at Dresden by the American Consul General, and found favor in the Saxon King's eyes on account of her simple gown; it consisted of 'a white tunic embroidered in pearls over white satin.' " This public domain book is available at Google Books.
